newsitem.title: CANADA: Bank of Canada 91-day T-bill yields avg 3.278 pct.
newsitem.headline: Bank of Canada 91-day T-bill yields avg 3.278 pct.

text.p: The Bank of Canada said the average yield at this week's auction of C$2.9 billion of 91-day Government of Canada treasury bills due July 3, 1997 was 3.278 percent, up from 3.186 percent last week.

The average yield on C$1.3 billion of 175-day T-bills due September 25, 1997 was 3.630 percent, up from 3.479 percent last week, and on C$1.2 billion of 364-day T-bills due April 2, 1998 was 4.220 percent, up from 3.918 percent.
The Bank bought C$475 million three-month, C$100 million six-month and C$100 million one-year bills. It holds C$825 million of C$5.4 billion bills due April 10. (Details follow)
For details of the latest week's T-bill auction, see BOCWATYQ ENTER. For details of next week's T-bill tender, see BOCWATYM ENTER.
